climbs.name: Right Crack
climbs.fa: First ascent:? First free solo ascent: Chris Terry?

content.description: The crack to the right of left crack. Climb the crack up to the giant jugs on the flake up to the ledge, and follow the flake to the left over the  super exposed small roof to a juggy topout. Super fun! The crux is two tiny crimps before a jug.
content.protection: Thin gear.  Two bolt anchor or toprope from roots/tree, or scary, exposed solo.
content.location: Just to the right of the first crack system (left crack) same finish.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt and do a v2 boulder problem. After that, it lets up a bit. clip 2 more bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Still, a little dirty, but it should clean up nicely.
content.location: the first rout on the left

content.description: Start on Redact This and traverse left after the second bolt.

Start on two jugs right next to each other and traverse as low as possible to the left crack route to the last ledge and step off. Reachy with small crimps. V5 comp style variation starts sitting on a jug down and right of the overhang on the arete.
content.location: The same start as the diagonal traverse.

content.description: The obvious crack system on the left side of the rock (the left most crack). Climb the crack up to the flake with giant jugs up to the ledge where you can rest and climb over the really exposed super scary section on the flake (follow the flake to the left slightly) to an easy top out on jugs. Very reachy route at times. 5.11a direct variation without bailing out left!
content.protection: Thin to medium gear.  Two bolt anchor or Top rope from giant tree roots or the trees themselves.
content.location: On the left side of the rock if facing it. The first route on the rock you can see when approached from the trail.

content.description: Start under the overhang on two obvious jugs and climb up the arete and do the same finish as the other problems on the flake.
content.protection: Sketchy top rope, or exposed, scary solo.

content.description: Right most route. Needs a lot of cleaning!
content.protection: Three bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: The two jugs next to the small roof.

content.description: Climb Right Crack past a bolt instead of traversing right. Go straight up the steep head wall with a second bolt then pull a really thin crux on slick edges.
content.protection: 2 bolts I placed a 0.3 and 2 in between bolts one and two
